page.title: 18 THE VILLAGE OF EYE
page.content: {Eye,}as its name suggests, is on an island of land formed by two streams. The word Eye or Ey was the{Saxon}word for water and is frequently used either alone or as a prefix to designate places located in low {situations.Eye Manor}was built in 1680 for Ferdinado Gorges, a Barbados slave trader. It is not very special from the outside but inside it is beautiful. Its ceilings have some of the richest decoration in the country. One mile away is{Berrington Hall, built for{Thomas Harley.}It was built by Henry Holland in 1778-81 and the park laid out by{Capability Brown. Harley had been Lord Mayor of London. He is buried in the little church at Eye. This is dark with many arches and small windows. It also has many tombs and memorials making it rather a dismal place.
